TopicTitle: Laythe Colony Ship: The Community project!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Tested the limits of my chaos star rocket - (without changing the launcher) - has i had around 500m/s of delta-V left with a 1000 ton payload in V1.02, with plenty of twr. Turns out i can launch 1500 tons to a 80x80 orbit with it... And stll have 200m/s of delta-V left in the upper stage at the end:p
> So, if needed, we still have quite some margins to stretch the propulsion section.
> 
> (I'll try to remove a stage or two on the chaos star (keeping the cores arrangements), to have a less powerful launcher still capable of launching delicate oversized payloads in a fairing (the wide upper stage on the chaos star allows to correctly strut any payload ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

You can launch payloads without fuel and re-fuel them in orbit.

Yes we can ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) but why bother ? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) launching the fuel tugs will be multilaunch, and you'll need to ferry the additional dry weight of the tugs ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

(And refuelling 14+ kerbodynes S3-14400 will either need 1 massive fuel tug as big as the propulsion unit, or a lot of small ones ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

The chaos star is only around 460 - 470 parts itself ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T13:47:10Z" title="05/04/2015 01:47  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by sgt\_flyer**
Although I'm right now studying for exams, I have a design or two that might aid this project.

............

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T17:47:26Z" title="05/04/2015 05:47  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by RevanCorana**

here's the Chaos Star MK2 and a 1530 tons propulsion unit (not necessarily final for the propulsion unit) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) - whooping 21,08% payload fraction ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (for only 2.430.597 Kr ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) - so 1588 Kr / ton ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/t5QL2)

i'll try to create alternative versions of the Chaos star - with the same size capacity, but less weight capacity ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) for large lightweight payloads ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (maybe with less side boosters ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

edit : here's the Chaos Star thread ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115732-V1-02-Chaos-Star-MK2-1500-tons-to-LKO-launcher](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/115732-V1-02-Chaos-Star-MK2-1500-tons-to-LKO-launcher)

and here's the link for the Chaos Star with the early version of the propulsion unit (which weights 1530 tons for 82 parts (if you include the 12 struts used to link the propulsion unit to the upper stage)) - 

[http://www./download/rvwghk3oa841t1k/Chaos+Star+MK2.craft](http://www./download/rvwghk3oa841t1k/Chaos+Star+MK2.craft)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T18:59:20Z" title="05/04/2015 06:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by sgt\_flyer**

Since atomic engines do not need oxydizer now, if you really want to put fuel in the spine, which I don't think is necessary nor a good idea part count wise, they're the best option especially considering the very high total weight will negate their low twr

................

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-04T17:46:46Z" title="05/04/2015 05:46  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 4, 2015</time> by RevanCorana**

@revancorana why duna ? Thought the OP stated he wanted to go to laythe ? (The inspiration model is a mars CSV though ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

> 
> we'll need to design a common adapter for the ship's spine - to have something capable of transmitting the thrust of the engines without having a noodly ship when we'll dock the various sections together.
> especially if we use Vernor engines (as they need a fuel source - unlike the monopropellant) - we'll need to be able to transmit the fuel along the whole spine, or have small fuel tanks at various sections of the ship.
> 
> edit : here's a possibility for a engine section (with an engineer 'room' ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) - the thing in the middle is a possibility for a 'spine' adapter design. - currently 89 parts - because of the struts needed. (also an 'example' of a 'spine' adapter - but this is bound to change - a bit too much part for such a part)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/EfwXXukl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/EfwXXukl.jpg)
> 
> note, this is the largest single section that can fit into a stock fairing for launch (and i have rebuilt my Chaos Star LV for V1.0 - it will have no problem lifting the fueled 758 tons of this engine section. - i added a central Kerbodyne S3 14400 tank for either - refuelling docked systems, or to be used as additionnal fuel for the main engines also includes 3x 2.5m RCS fuel tanks. (note, this engine block can still be stretched a bit if we need additionnal fuel tanks - my Chaos Star can lift 1000 tons in one go to LKO.)
> 
> i'll try to design something for the solar arrays ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Is there any chance that you could provide a download link?

could you make the bays 1.5x long Mk 3 cargobay? it will fit all the modules perfectly and with docking ports (2.5m) on each side it would be secure (although they have in them enough parachutes, thrust and fuel to land on any planet with atmosphere)
Also guys, remember, this is going to Laythe, so SAVE PART COUNT by using less rockets and 'chutes!

> 
> Is there any chance that you could provide a download link?

the stretched version of the propulsion unit is inside the Chaos Star, 4 posts above yours ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) - here's the stretched unit ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)[http://www./download/rv...Star+MK2.craft](http://www./download/rv...Star+MK2.craft) - the stretched unit is 1530 tons ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) - just remove the launcher, and you'll be able to see the stretched version of the propulsion unit ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

(now, i need to rebuild a less powerful version of the chaos star, to launch lighter (but still extra wide ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) payloads ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> the stretched version of the propulsion unit is inside the Chaos Star, 4 posts above yours ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) - here's the stretched unit ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)[http://www./download/rv...Star+MK2.craft](http://www./download/rv...Star+MK2.craft) - the stretched unit is 1530 tons ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) - just remove the launcher, and you'll be able to see the stretched version of the propulsion unit ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> (now, i need to rebuild a less powerful version of the chaos star, to launch lighter (but still extra wide ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) payloads ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

We could use something like this, but I think, to save space and part count, we could make a separate ship (Someone else's idea) for Kerbals so we don't add lag.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Heh, there's over 50 struts in that. Those Mk3 modules don't connect with much strength though but I guess you could trim the amount down a bit.
> Dry weight of the ship may be in the region of 1000 tons. I've no idea what the weight with fuel will be. Maybe 4-5000 tons? I've seen people launch almost that into orbit so it's do-able.
> 
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> If you want an idea of the scale that can be built then have a look at a space cruise liner I built once.
> 
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98105-Space-Cruise-Liner](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98105-Space-Cruise-Liner)
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/XjH46AU.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/XjH46AU.jpg)

Ok, how many parts. We could modify that into the crew carrier!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I have a plan for the ship. I'll hop on KSP right now and design something.

Can't wait to see what it is!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> OP is not online now. Slow it down so he can catch up, eh?

Working on it!

> 
> Sure, the OP should just keep in mind a few things: 
> -The vehicle cargo bays should have fuel and be vtol landers, to bring stuff in and out of the station-spacecraft including mined fuel.
> 
> -All modules have to fit inside a 3.75m fairing max. for the Kerbin launch.
> 
> -Part count has to be as low as possible or none will be able to actually enjoy it.

Yep, needs VTOL and we also need a way to get the decent stage/lander away (out of physics range) from the base.

The modules probably will be able to, but I have an idea if the fairing won't work. I don't think it will come to that though. Also, some parts have enough heat resistance to make it through the atmosphere. And also again, some modules will keep their farings for Laythe landing.

Yes, part count is a major concern, and that's why we might need to make 3 or 4 ships.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Basic Habitation section. Yeah it could look better but it's sturdy and has a low part count.
> [http://i.imgur.com/396XEhW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/396XEhW.jpg)
> 
> 107 parts. 118.2 tons. Room for 256 Kerbals.

Another great idea. I'll start PMing people for download links so I can edit these for the ship.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Even with simplified parts this thing will be over 1000 parts I'm sure.
> You could use a giant fairing for the front of the ship with a giant lander inside.
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/WDGuXY7.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/WDGuXY7.jpg)
> 
> Hmmm, very good question. I depends on whether you consider the ship re-usable or just a bunch of massive components that make a shake and bake colony setup.

The fairing is exactly what I had in mind, and also, these craft are not reusable. This is a CSV (Colony Set-up Vehicle) so it's not coming back.

If we tried, it could be, but it might be way to hard and have to many parts.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> i can give advices / help for animating stuff and various constructions tricks ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) (i have various ideas to make deployable huge solar arrays (using my stock hinges ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) so they can be folded into a fairing for the launch. 
> now, solar panels are not going to be very useful on jool ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (gigantor's mass versus electricity /s is worse than RTGs...)
> 
> though, this kind of ship will need to be space built ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) the biggest fairings won't be able to enclose that thing for a single launch ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (still, we'll need various reliable launch vehicle to ferry the various parts (some heavy, some oversized ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

Ok, construction tricks are the best!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Ok so i'm proud to present my base pack! it has several modules- A living quarters module, A science lab module, A cargo module, A science rover (cargo variant) module, A science bus (cargo variant) module, A base manager module and last but not least a fully independent mining and production module. 
> each module sports 4 "Thud" engines (Thrust limit is 37.5 OOTB). 
> 
> The Kit also comes with a 2 part aeroshell (shell and nose which come with RCS and RCS thrusters) for beautiful descent through atmospheres and and a base end part for compatible builds and expansions (please make the provided probe core the root part after attaching). 
> 
> Please consult the craft file for specifics but AG 1 is Landing Legs, AG 2 is Gears, AG 3-4 variable and AG 5 is the engines. 
> 
> Assembling the base is done with the base manager module on rover wheels alone OR with gear extended(dosnt matter) and all other modules with extended wheels. 
> 
> [**DropBox Folder**](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/be8ihjiidiu6cno/AAD0KKLB01L-fWoD_yeZE4Yba?dl=0)(feel free to add to it).
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/UWNrj](http://imgur.com/a/UWNrj)

Going through this and editing it now!
